info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:17AM EDT until June 14 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT FOR JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN MONROE...EASTERN BELMONT...SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...WESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN GREENE...OHIO... NORTHEASTERN WETZEL...MARSHALL...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 116 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Carrollton to near Wintersville to Wellsburg to Cameron, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Trees snapped and uprooted. Power outages can be expected. Locations impacted include... Wheeling, Weirton, Steubenville, Moundsville, Martins Ferry, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Warwood, Wellsburg, Bethlehem, West Liberty, and Triadelphia. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
